resources.string: The basic eternal principle of the universe that transcends reality and is the source of being, non-being, and change is the Dao. Put the two together and you have Kismet Dao, the “Way of Fate”.
Situated in the centre of Brașov, Kronhaus provides non-smoking rooms with a sunny balcony. For a comfortable holiday experience, a free car park, a beauty salon and a barber shop are also available.
Our rooms are individually designed and furnished to be stylish and comfortable. All units are fitted with minibar, TV with premium cable channels, free wifi and wired high-speed Internet.

Enjoy superb views of the city, perfect service and culinary delights in the hotel restaurant. Utmost attention is paid to every single detail, ensuring that you spend an unforgettable stay at the Ambient hotel.

Guests can enjoy views of the surrounding mountains in each room and there is a bathroom with a shower or a bathtub provided in all of Casa Corona units. A ski storage room can be used on site and airport shuttle services can be requested.
Features a stylish à la carte restaurant, state-of-the art facilities, and free WiFi. Belaqva Spa and Wellness Center offers beauty therapies, a fitness studio, a sauna and an indoor pool.
An architectural jewel of the 19th century, finely restored to the smallest details of the original indoor painting and brought back to life in the form of a boutique hotel.
Situated 15 minutes walk from Brasov old town, it offers spacious and elegant rooms with amazing views over Mount Tampa and it is a great starting point to explore Poiana Brasov, Bran or Predeal.

Located at about 5 min drive from city centre, Casa Jasmine offers air-conditioned rooms that comes with a minibar and TV. The restaurant serves delicious local and international dishes in a cosy atmosphere.
Offering beautiful views from the balconies and easily accessible, it is next to the northern escarpment of Bucegi Mountains, surrounded by the Barsa Mountains and next to the Timis River.
📍 Colonel Kiss Sándor Str, Brașov, România\n☏ +40 268259520
Guests can sample Romanian and European cuisine at the hotel restaurant and enjoy the views over Brasov Citadel from the Belvedere Club, which is on Hotel Aro Palace top floor.

The hotel boasts a marvellous view and it is a perfect place for business and leisure travellers alike. It is close to the forest and between 2 ski resorts, but also near the biggest commercial area of the city.

Along with a restaurant, this smoking-free hotel has a 24-hour fitness centre and a bar/lounge. WiFi and car park are also included. Additionally, spa services, conference space and concierge services are available on-site.
Guesta have free access to the spa facilities including an indoor pool, a hot tub and different types of saunas. You can also choose from a range of massages and spa therapies.
All rooms have their own bathrooms with shower, hairdryer, bath set, bathrobes and slippers. In addition, there is a concierge service, a sauna, a massage room and a conference room.

Brașov is a city in the Transylvania region of Romania, ringed by the Carpathian Mountains. It is known for its medieval Saxon walls and bastions, the towering Gothic-style Black Church and lively cafes. Piaţa Sfatului (Council Square) in the cobbled old town is surrounded by colorful baroque buildings and is home to the Casa Sfatului, a former town hall turned local history museum.\n\nJust beyond Council Square is the shop-lined street of Strada Republicii. In the neighborhood of Şchei, a Romanian enclave during Saxon rule, lies the reconstructed Orthodox St. Nicholas Church, originally built in the 1300s. The First Romanian School on the church grounds displays cultural artifacts like rare books. Nearby the 16th-century fortification of Weaver Bastion, hiking trails and a cable car lead to the summit of forested Mt. Tâmpa. Attractions outside town include Bran Castle, long associated with the Dracula legend, and Poiana Brașov, a popular ski resort.

Hike up one of the twisting trails or ride a cable car to reach the top of Mount Tampa. The mountain rises 900 m (2,952 ft) above sea level as a landmark that divides the new area of the town from its medieval section.
📍 Parent ranges: The Sub Carpathians, Carpathian Mountains
Longtime zoo on 25 acres offering visitors a unique lions den view, a reptile house and a playground.

The place is perfect for a lovely stroll as you gain more positive energy from the surrounding nature. If you’re traveling with family, the plains around the lake can serve as ideal spots for picnics.
Peaceful Poiana Brașov is home to a ski resort of the same name, with trails on Postăvaru Mountain, plus an ice-skating rink, an indoor recreation center, and a sports complex with tubing and luging.
📍 Lift system: 2 aerial tramways; 2 chairlift; 5 ski lifts; 1 gondola; 1 magic carpet

The Seven Ladders Canyon is a mountainous canyon carved by the Șapte Scări Brook in Romania in the county of Brașov, south of Timișu de Jos village. It is considered to be one of the main tourist attractions from the Piatra Mare massif.
📍 Depth: 58 m, Length: 160 metres (520 ft) North-West to South-East

Strategically overlooking the town and the plains to North, the Citadel is part of Brasov outer fortification system. In the center of the Citadel is a narrow courtyard displaying shields, lances, a canon and coat of arms.

Ridged by the Teutonic Knights, the Feldioara Fortress is the oldest fortification in Brasov County, being documented since 1225. At the time of its construction, t had strong walls and was the most important fortification in Transylvania.
Dramatic, 14th-century castle, former royal residence and alleged legend of Count Dracula inspiration. The fortress is on the Transylvanian side of the historical border with Wallachia.
📍 At just 15 miles away from Brașov.

Preserved fortress bastion built in the 15th century, now housing a medieval museum. In the Middle Ages were organized in so called guildes,and each guild had the responsibility to defend a certain section of the town walls.

Yekaterina Gate in Braşov, Romania, was built by the Tailors’ Guild, in 1559 for defensive purposes instead of an old gate destroyed by the flood in 1526. It is named after St. Yekaterina Monastery that was situated here in former times.
📍 Ludwig van Beethoven Str, Brașov, România
Outdoor adventure park by a lake offering forest-lined ropes and zipline courses for all levels. A recreational activity outdoors, a very enjoyable way to spend free time with family and friends.
Spacious leisure center with 6 heated indoor pools, 3 types of sauna, a fitness room, a large hot tub, a relaxing grotto and 3 massage salons.
Dino Parc Râșnov is the biggest dinosaur theme park in Eastern Europe, an unique and special project in Romania. It has a lot of particularities, but the most important are the 100 dinosaurs.
Paintball is a sport where men, women, young people or the elderly can compete on a level playing field. Intelligence and determination are more important than height, physical strength or character.
Immerse into a fascinating adventure and enjoy forever the lifetime memories you have made! Superland offers endless ways to have fun for both children and parents.
Sub Tâmpa brings a new and fresh outlook on old traditional romanian cuisine, with a focus on Transyvanian recipes.
📍 SPECIAL DIETS: Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Gluten Free Options.

Belvedere restaurant has its desire to be unique, by being the most beautiful location in Brasov, and particularly through the elaborate cuisine, healthy and innovative specific to a "Haute cuisine" approach.
📍 MEALS: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner, Brunch, After-hours, Drinks.

If you want rabbit with rhubarb or duck with cherries in Brasov then you best get yourself here. No fewer than 10 champagnes on the wine list (including La Grande Dame), occasional live music and all in gorgeous surroundings.

If you enjoy great food, and an extensive wine list this is the best place to visit in Brasov. The truffle steak, truffle pasta, salmon tartare, sea-bass, mussels, and more are always cooked perfectly.
📍 FEATURES: Outdoor Seating, Wheelchair Accessible, Accepts Credit Cards, Table Service, Live Music.
Small Italian restaurant, just off the main square,where you can find fresh and tasty meals.
📍 SPECIAL DIETS: Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Gluten Free Options.
Small traditional restaurant serving mainly soups and stews, cooked fresh every day with local ingredients, in a village outside the city and served fast in the Old Town Market.
A unique restaurant. An old cellar at the heart of old Town Brasov. They serve cracklings with red onion and home made bread on the house! For great offers, you can also download their application.
📍 SPECIAL DIETS: Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Gluten Free Options
If you want fresh and tasty Romanian food these is the number 1 restaurant is part of the Sergiana group and as in any Sergiana restaurant the food is amazing and always fresh.
📍 CUISINES: Barbecue, European, Eastern European, Central European, Romanian.
Pork greaves with red onions and fresh bread, on the house! The cooks are prepared to pamper your taste buds. The food selection is such that anyone can find amazing food options.
📍 FEATURES: Reservations, Television, Highchairs Available, Wheelchair Accessible, Free Wifi, Table Service.
Discover this real hidden gem of a restaurant in terms of good service, really nice food, and very good value.

Prato restaurant is situated right in the heart of the Brasov old town. Prato menu is especially created to highlight seasonal, local ingredients along with Mediterranean flavors for dishes that are as delicious as they are stunning.
Located in a former wine cellar, it offers a great variety of Transylvanian cousine and beside the menu you can ask what songs to be played from their playlist.
📍 FEATURES: Private Dining, Highchairs Available, Serves Alcohol, Full Bar, Accepts Credit Cards, Table Service.

Welcome to Keller, the place where senses feel at home. Here you will admire, you will taste, you will smell, you will listen and you will feel that food made with great care and precision touches all the five senses.
📍 MEALS: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner, Brunch, After-hours.
Being located in the city centre, Taverna Sarbului is one of the traditional tourist restaurants in Brasov, with all the local imagery, food and atmosphere.

From excellent bruschetta through spectacularly good dorada and chicken with mushrooms to a lava cake with very good melon ice cream this is a restaurant with a new slimmed down menu and big intentions.
📍 CUISINES: Italian, Pizza, Seafood, Mediterranean, European.
